page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Arborfield Junior school is 112 years old and was built in 1873.Only about forty children went.Some local people helped build it.There were only a few classrooms with ten children in each class.The first school in arborfield was in Greensward lane. The school has changed over the years since opening.Parts of the original building have been demolished and replaced with modern classrooms.However,the main bulk of the of the building still stands.There are approximately 155 pupils in the school today.Since 1980 the population has decreased from approximately 220 to 150 children.Because of this the school has lost a wooden building which had two classes.On the other side of the playground stands the infant school.
